Sure, here are some tips to avoid boredom when running:

1. Vary the route: Running the same route every day can become monotonous. Try changing your route or exploring new areas. 2. Listen to music or podcasts: Listening to music or podcasts can make your run more enjoyable and engaging. 3. Run with a friend: Running with a friend can be a great way to make the run more fun and social. 4. Mix up the pace: Try varying your pace throughout the run. This can help you stay engaged and challenge yourself. 5. Set goals: Setting goals for your running can help you stay focused and motivated. Try setting distance or time goals to work towards. 6. Practice mindfulness: Pay attention to your surroundings, your breathing, and your body. This can help you stay present and engaged in the run. 7. Try interval training: Interval training involves alternating periods of high-intensity running with periods of rest or low-intensity running. This can help keep things interesting and provide a challenge.
